result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Javon A. Charo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Javon A. Charo.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver form filed. Minutes filed.
Arraignment scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Javon A. Charo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen M Compton in court for Javon A. Charo.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Javon A. Charo in court, in custody by video.  Prosecuting attorney Zeke S Wiedenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane appeared specially. SPD needs more time to appoint. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Javon A. Charo in court, in custody by video. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared specially. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Javon A. Charo appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DA Wiedenfeld.  Attorney Christopher Lyle Kuehn in court for Javon A. Charo. Called @ 1:39 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance on 22CF376, adjourned initial appearance on 22CF286, and statuses on 20CM694, 21CF96, and 22CF268.  Record by Atty Kuehn as to his motion to withdraw due to conflict. Court will grant the request and instructs Atty. Kuehn to submit proper proposed order. New attorney will be appointed by the SPD's office. Court sets next hearing to see if new attorney has been appointed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

TOTAL BOND COVERS 22GF662, 22CF286, 22CF268, 21CF96 & 20CM694
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons.  
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR TYLER FREUND. NO CONTACT WITH JUAN CHARO.Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant in court in custody via video with attorney Josh Ryan Polczinski for Chris Kuehn. DA Wiedenfeld appears for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Ryan Polczinksi hs review pretrial risk assessment. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
